RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 1M Turf CR: 70. Claiming Purse 15000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 Mile and 70 Yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COUSIN VICKIE was off a touch slow, raced from off of the pace, raced in the three path. launched a bid after the half mile, circled through the turn, battled, nosed rival out for fourth. DANAS MULE raced off of the pace, raced on the rail, saved ground, ran an even race. RIPTIDE ROSE vied for the lead, took command and raced two wide, wet the early fractions, was challenged in the upper stretch, battled briefly then gave way but did enough to hold on for second. BEULAH K stalked the front runners, raced on the rail, improved, position, shifted into the two path in the upper stretch, but did not have enough today. BOSTON PAULETTE stalked the early leader from the three path, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole, drew next to the front runner by the quarter pole, battled with that rival until the eighth pole, finally over took that competitor and got up for the win in the last few jumps. SUE'S LITTLE ZING raced from mid pack in the four path but had no kick. SWEET LITTLE ROSE was off in the middle of the field, raced three wide, was on the muscle through the first turn and down the back side, advanced quickly, circled the field through the turn, was in contention and was asked in the stretch drive but struggled to switch leads and could not make the lead.

ENTRY.NAME: Cousin Vickie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, 3w, bid 1/2, circled, battled

ENTRY.NAME: Danas Mule
ENTRY.OWNER: Salome Robert Joseph and Salome Dana
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, ran an even race

ENTRY.NAME: Riptide Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, set the pace, 2w, battled, gave way, held 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Beulah K
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, shifted 2 wide, upper, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Boston Paulette
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, bid 5-16th, drew next to leader 1/4, battled, led

ENTRY.NAME: Sweet Little Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, strong backside, advanced, circled left lead

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 10000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRIMESTONE KID was off mid pack, raced in the two path, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, then faltered in the stretch. EASY BIG BOY stalked the front runners from the two path, stayed inside through the turn, was cued at the quarter pole, responded well by closing ground racing in between foes, closed well all the way until the wire getting up for third. BIG SCULLY used his natural speed to get to the front, took the lead and raced in the two path, set the pace until the five sixteenth marker, was challenged by another rival who had been pressuring the whole trip, battled with that one, had the inside advantage but gave way in the stretch. WESLEYAN stalked the early leader from the three path, kept the pressure on the leader, was given rein at the five sixteenth pole and drew beside the leader, battled, took command by the the quarter pole and drew off bu the eighth pole securing the win. DOUBLE TRAP raced from mid pack, stayed on the rail early on, shifted into the six path in the upper stretch, struggled to switch leads and faded. ONE TOUGH CHARLIE stalked the pace from the four path, launched a bid at the five sixteenth pole, then stopped in the stretch. XANTHUS WRATH was off a touch slow, raced off of the pace, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, angled into the six path through the turn, was under heavy encouragement, shifted eight wide in the upper stretch but made little progress. AMERICAN SMOOTH was off in the middle of the field, raced five wide, was asked at the quarter pole,, responded well and out finished the rest. CHIEFWEAVE was off in the middle of the field, raced four wide but never got involved today.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Scully
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed, led, 2w, under pressure, hand ridded 5-16th, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Double Trap
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, shifted 6 wide, upper stretch, left lead

ENTRY.NAME: Xanthus Wrath
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, bid 3/8, under heavy encouragement, 6w,

ENTRY.NAME: American Smooth
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, asked 1/4, out finished the rest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 7 1/2F Turf CR: 69. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on th e main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPARKIN vied for the lead, lead while racing on the rail, set the pace to his liking, went un contested through out, much the best. RONALDS GATSBY stalked the pace from the three path, chased down the stretch and was second best today. C P'S WILD FIRE was in the bridle early and asked to race straight, raced off of the pace, was strong in the bridle and quickly advanced on the outside in the four path, continued to move past the field willingly, had raced up to third in the upper stretch, ran out of room. LINCOLN PRODUCTION was off mid pack, raced in the three path and ran an even race. CLASSIC WARRIOR was off in the middle of the field, was pushed out in the first turn, settled along the rail down the back side, launched a bid at the three eighths pole then tired in the stretch. OWEN THE ICE MAN raced from off of the pace, raced on the rail and saved ground, made one run and was able to out finish the rest. TRIPLE was off in mid pack, raced in the five path, shuffled back a bit, launched a bid at the three eighths pole and found his bet stride late. SNAKEBIT trailed the field early, raced in the two path and mildly gained late. SPIRIT OF DREAMS stalked, got out in the first turn, raced five wide and showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Owen the Ice Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, rail, one run, saved ground, out finished

ENTRY.NAME: C P's Wild Fire
ENTRY.COMMENT: took back early, off pace, advanced quickly, 4w, maintained

ENTRY.NAME: Triple
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 5w, schufled back, bid 3/8, closed, best stride late

ENTRY.NAME: Sparkin
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, pace, rail, uncontested through out, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Spirit of Dreams
ENTRY.OWNER: Winalot Racing LLC Evans Thoroughbred Racing LLC and Cleek Phillip

ENTRY.NAME: Classic Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, pushed out 1st, settled, rail, bid 3/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 17000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SECRET GUITAR stalked the pace setter from the rail, saved ground, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, gained ground through the turn, closed well on the rail, just missed running a nice second. RONA VISION raced off of the pace, in the two path, was asked to settle to avoid an erratic foes, angled out into the five path in the upper stretch, was kept on point and was able to get up for third. NIGHT TIZZY was a bit rank for the early part of the race, finally settled and ran even. DELTA NIGHTS vied for the lead, raced two wide and could not sustain the bid. TRIPLE THE GOLD stalked, pressured the leader, took control led into the furlong ground, went wrong and vanned off. LITTLE Z stalked the leader, raced in the four path, then shifted into the eight path in the upper stretch, drifted out down the stretch, was under heavy encouragement, got up in time for the win. TRIPPLE THE GOLD WAS PULLED UP AFTER THE EIGHTH MILE POLE AND VANNED OFF.

ENTRY.NAME: Secret Guitar
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, bid 3/8, saved ground, closed well, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Rona Vision
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled, shifted 5w, circled, kept on point,

ENTRY.NAME: Night Tizzy
ENTRY.OWNER: Beene Linda D and Rowe Stephen

ENTRY.NAME: Triple the Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, pressured, led, went wrong, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Little Z
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 4w, 8 wide, upper, closed, drifted out, up inn time

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 1 1/16M Turf CR: 73. Maiden Special Weight Purse 24000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. (Preference To Horses That Have Not Started For A Claiming Price Of Less Than $25,000). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it wil l be run on the main track at 1 1/16 Miles).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SYVESTAR was off mid pack, raced in the four path, launched a bid at the half mile pole, advanced, matched strides with the leader near the seven sixteenth pole, took control at the five sixteenth pole, drew off for the win. MONOLITH was off in the middle of the field, raced four wide, launched a bid at the three eighths pole, was encouraged through the turn, took third place entering the upper stretch, was asked a responded well closing down the stretch, gaining ground with every stride, struggled to switch leads but still ran a game second. ROULETTE raced from mid pack, saved ground, shifted into the six path in the upper stretch, was asked and responded well closing with every stride. KING ARTHUR RIDGE trailed the field for the first half, made on run, started at the half, raced on the rail and saved ground, closed well along the rail, angled into the three path at the eighth mile pole to pass tiring rivals, shifted back to the rail and continued to close well. GOLDEN GREEK raced from off of the pace, raced inn the two path, saved ground, shifted into the four path in the upper stretch and closed well. MONEYSTRIKE vied for the lead, raced in the four path, drew next to the leader after the half mile pole, co led until he gave way at the five sixteenth pole. UNAFFILIATED was off mid pack, raced on the rail and ran an even race. OLCZYK was off in mid pack, raced in the two path, launched a bid at the half, stalked the pace, went wrong, eased and vanned off. SASSI D vied for the lead, raced two wide, co led, then tired late. MODOC raced mid pack in the four path and faded. SHAMEFUL ALLIANCE raced id pack in the five path and showed little. GRAND ENCORE was off in the middle of the filed, raced three wide, briefly surged, but was no threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Unaffiliated
ENTRY.OWNER: Sanderson Laurie and Cartier Nanette C
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack rail ran an even race

ENTRY.NAME: Roulette
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, saved ground, shifted 4 wide, upper closed

ENTRY.NAME: Olczyk
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, bid 1/2, stalked, went wrong, eased, vanned off

ENTRY.NAME: Syvestar
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, bid 1/2, advanced, matched leader 7-16th, led 5-16t

ENTRY.NAME: Monolith
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, bid 3/8, encouraged turn, 3rd upper, left lead, cld

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Greek
ENTRY.OWNER: Masino Racing Stable and Maller Bruce

ENTRY.NAME: Grand Encore
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, surged briefly, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Shameful Alliance
ENTRY.OWNER: Simpson Bruce and Simpson Sarah H

ENTRY.NAME: King Arthur Ridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rail, one run, moved 1/2, saved ground, shifted 3w1/8

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HOWL YEAH raced from off of the pace early, raced in the four path, was allowed to settle, made one run, launching a bid at the half mile pole, raced four wide as he circled the field through the turn, was asked to closed and responded well, gaining ground with every stride, drifted out a bit in the stretch, bur continued to gain ground and was able to get up in time for the win. ROYAL DE BE vied for the lead, raced on the rail, set the pace, showed the way into the furlong grounds where he was caught late by a fast closing outside rival and missed for the win but ran a game second still. WINNING DANCE raced in the middle of the field, raced on the rail, improved and stalked the leader, saved ground, was asked and responded closing down thee stretch well getting third. TRAFFIC BOSS stalked the leader from the four path, pressured through out, then finished flat in the stretch. RED OCTOBER was off mid pack, raced in the four path, launched a bid at the quarter pole and found his best stride late. ALL TOGETHER stalked the pace, ran in the two and three paths, ran an even race. PROSPECTOR'S POINT trailed the field, was allowed to settle, launched a bid at the quarter pole and closed well but had to much to do. CRAZY MUGGS stalked the pace from the four path then tired. SEEKING CHROME was off in the middle of the field and improved slightly. THINKINGNDRINKING raced from off of the pace, raced in the five path and mid pack, maintained that position through out. SHOETRICK raced in the three path from the middle of the filed and posed no threat. ALPHIN flashed early speed then retreated.

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Dance
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, stalked, saved ground, improved, closed well

ENTRY.NAME: Red October
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, bid 1/4, best stride late

ENTRY.NAME: Howl Yeah
ENTRY.OWNER: Smith Mike Smith Daria and East Austin Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, bid 1/2, one run, circled turn, drifted out, up

ENTRY.NAME: Royal de Be
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, caught late, held sway for 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Thinkingndrinking
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 5w, maintained position through out

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 7 1/2F Turf CR: 88. Starter Optional Claiming Purse 15000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $7,500 OR LESS IN 2022 - 2023 OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 11, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Cla iming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SKYKAT mid pack, two wide, rail, closed. SUMMERTIME BANDIT vied, led, rail, tired. ANGEL OF VERDUN vied, led, rail, tired. CALAJA stalked, ran an even race. WATRUGONNADOKAREN raced from off of the pace, raced in the four path, angled out into the eight path in the upper stretch and closed well. MARY JACK raced mid pack raced on the rail, bid at the half mile pole and closed. TIZ MY PLAN off pace, trailed, 3w, mild gain. BAR TAP mid pack, improved then faded. LIL ASHLEY B. off slow, off pace, o5w, gained late. HUSHED COURT ROOM stalked, four wide, ran even. VISIONOFWILDTIMES stalked, five wide and faded. WENDY WILECAT raced mid pack in the three path and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Lil Ashley B.
ENTRY.OWNER: Duffy's Racing Stable LLC and Heider Racing Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, o5w, gained late

ENTRY.NAME: Skykat
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 2w, edged in rail, closed up in time for the win

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz My Plan
ENTRY.OWNER: Beene Linda D and Rowe Stephen

ENTRY.NAME: Mary Jack
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail , bid 1/2, shifted 9 wide, upper

ENTRY.NAME: Angel of Verdun
ENTRY.OWNER: Peterson Stephen J and Peterson Konnor

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 1 1/16M Turf CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, STATE BRED OR TRIAL OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over On The Turf Since August 11 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at 1 1/16 Miles).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREEDOM FACTOR gate to wire winner. MONARCH'S MISCHIEF stalked, no match for winner. BRITTS A CLOSER stalked, challenged, finished even. SMARTY ALEX mid pack, gained late. RUM 'N TONIC stalked, ran an even race. HUDSON'S TURN raced from off of the pace, made one run an close well. HEZA PICKLE was off a tough slow, raced off of the pace, settled, made one run at the quarter pole, and hit his best stride late. FATHER RED mid pack, maintained. DEER CROSSING off pace, gained slightly. COWBOY RIDGE vied, stalked, tired. BAY BE GONE off pace, no threat. BIG BOO showed lilttle.l.

ENTRY.NAME: Smarty Alex
ENTRY.OWNER: Reeves Kathy Eleven One Racing Stables LLC and Joe Hackler Racing LP

ENTRY.NAME: Hudson's Turn
ENTRY.OWNER: Bockmon Danny The Ravens Rock Farm LLC and Currey Stephen
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, settled, one run, closed

ENTRY.OWNER: Powell Dane Lay and Garza Joaquin E
